text:
This patch to rotatelogs adds a `-c' option which causes rotatelogs to 
automatically create a `logfile.current' symlink pointing to the most recent 
logfile. This is convenient when using a tail(1) that understands reopened 
files.

As a side effect I changed option parsing to use apr_getopt. Hope I got that 
part right. One potential caveat is that the current patch unlinks `logfile.
current' even if -c is not specified. This way at least a stale symlink will be 
cleaned up but it does incur an obvious risk for people unaware of the feature.

text:
cronolog has a solution for this and many other piped logging requirements.  Is
there some fundamental issue preventing widespread use of cronolog?  IOW, why
would we want to move into the middle ground between very basic piped logger
functionality and kitchen sink piped logger functionality?

(cronolog works great for me and I use such a feature.)
Also, big -1 on this patch, as symlink() is not portable.
